It feels like kiasa didn't know what to do with this story arc. It's SO convoluted. Not once in this whole arc did Nagi ever come to a singular conclusion and when she finally did toward the end, it's in complete contradiction to what she gets off on....which was explained in that same chapter. She gets off on cheating sex with Touya, but steeled herself to date Aoyama, but avoided him for 3 months to fuck Touya, but is reminded of Aoyama, but gets off on cheating sex with....Touya? Aoyama? @bbdo I mean, when was the last time you read a NTR that can be explained with logic? Abandoning logic is the only way of making this dead genre work when you're just trying to cash in on the trend. If you have characters with brain cells in a NTR, then there's no story. Saying "This NTR makes no sense" is like saying that the rain is wet today. But yeah, I agree that this one is especially retarded and all over the place.

Then there appears to be a time skip, probably after high school and already in college, where she is still technically cheating on the pres with her best friend. But for some reason she ran away from pres (none of this is clarified as to why) then once she sees pres again, she realizes that glasses girl was also sleeping with pres, in some weird 4 way exchange between the 4 of them. So for FMC to no longer feel guilty for betraying her feelings for her best friend decides to succumb to pres, and will probably continue this wierd 4-way they all share. I just feel Kiasa did not know what they wanted to do with this story. The only person's intention that was ever made clear is the glasses girl who just likes to sleep around. Everyone else's motives are either wishy washy like FMC and her best friend, or just simply unexplained like the pres.

So for a quick summary, FMC likes her best friend, but it appears he never made the move and actually liked glasses girl, but FMC also had slight crush on president. So once best friend like glasses girl and had sex, FMC decides to give in to pres to avoid having to face the pain of losing best friend to glasses. Then FMC's perception of president also became tarnished since all he seems to care about is sexually conquering her and not actually caring for her. Then they swing at the beach, and FMC realizes that her best friend also somewhat liked her and she wished she could have given her first time to her best friend instead of pres. so in way to avoid her poor choice, she decides to fall into depravity with the pres. but then also liked the cheating aspect of sex with her best friend, which also doesnt seem to make sense, since she appeared to really like her best friend and wanted to be with him.
can some one explain the story this shit hurts my brain
Honestly reading this is like... why did she do that?... what wtf just happened? wtf is going on.

This was just all over the place, it makes even less sense now that I re-read it. After two timing the pres with her friend at the end of the 3rd chapter, I just took it fully as her just becoming addicted to sex, but then out of nowhere she says she has to stop cheating? if I am not mistaken in the beginning of the 4th chapter then goes back to the pres for another fix of sex, but then says she wants to forget about her best friend? So which is it? Is it the sex, the cheating, the pres, the friend? It really is all over the place and that line just feels so tacked on in order to call this NTR when in reality, everyone is just having sex with everyone, only the best friend is out of the loop of what happened in the first chapter and the pres's original plan, meanwhile she is just out here doing whatever she wants, the character switch in the last chapter was just out of place and honestly it should have just ended in the 3rd chapter, 4 chapter just unnecessarily created more questions.
